Class AddCredit

  • java.lang.Object
    • AddCredit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transaction

    public class AddCredit
extends java.lang.Object
implements Transaction
    Provides methods and attributes for processing the addcredit transaction.
    Author:
    Jonathan Gillett, Daniel Smullen, Rayan Alfaheid

    • Constructor Detail

      • AddCredit

        public AddCredit(java.lang.String username,
         java.lang.String type,
         java.lang.Double credit,
         java.lang.String transaction)
        Constructor for the class. Accepts and populates class attributes with values passed in.
        Parameters:
        username - String value for the user to add credit to.
        type - String value for the type of user specified in username.
        credit - The amount of credit, in dollars, to add to the user specified in username.
        transaction - String containing the original transaction string from the daily transaction file.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(CurrentUserAccounts cua,
           AvailableTickets atf)
             throws FailedConstraint
        Performs the addcredit transaction. Adds the credit specified to the user specified.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Transaction
        Parameters:
        cua - A reference to the CurrentUserAccounts object used by the back-end.
        atf - A reference to the AvailableTickets object used by the back-end.
        Throws:
        FailedConstraint - Throws a failed constraint under the following circumstances:
        If the user name specified does not exist.
        If the amount of credit added results in a credit overflow for that user.
        If the amount of credit added is beyond the limit acceptable for that user type.
        See Also:
        Transaction.execute(CurrentUserAccounts, AvailableTickets)

      • getTransaction

        public java.lang.String getTransaction()
        Description copied from interface: Transaction
        Generic access method for obtaining the original transaction string for the transaction.
        Specified by:
        getTransaction in interface Transaction
        Returns:
        Returns the original transaction string.
